properties.headline: ELEVATE Sydney - SYDNEY Cahill Expressway above Circular Quay between Domain Tunnel AND Sydney Harbour Bridge

properties.otherAdvice:
The Cahill Expressway northbound lanes from the Domain Tunnel to the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed from 10pm Thursday 30 December 2021 to 4am Friday 7 January 2022 for Sydney New Year’s Eve and ELEVATE Sydney on the Circular Quay Overpass.

The Cahill Walk shared path is closed until 4am 7 Jan.

Lane 4 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will close each night from 9.30pm to 10.30pm from 1 - 5 January while the ELEVATE Sydney Sky Show takes place.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour Tunnel during the closure period so allow extra travel time.
properties.diversions: Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Sydney CBD via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St to rejoin the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

properties.headline: Cricket Test Match - Wednesday 5 to Sunday 9 January - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The Ashes Test Match: Australia v England at the SCG from Wednesday 5 - Sunday 9 January. Starts daily from 10.30am, ends daily around 5.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium, particularly at the start and end of play each day. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Fans travelling from the north are reminded that the Cahill Expressway is closed in both directions for roadwork and major events. The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open but allow extra travel time as delays are expected particularly in the morning ahead of start of play. You can also continue across the Harbour Bridge and detour via the city to join the Eastern Distributor to travel to and from Moore Park. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 6.30am Wednesday 5 January and remain closed until 7.30pm Saturday. Driver Ave may also close on Sunday if required.

Access EP3 and EP2 grass car parks on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Motorists travelling south on the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 6am to 7pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Sydney New Year's Eve - SYDNEY CBD various roads in Circular Quay, The Rocks and surrounding areas
properties.publicTransport: Check transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2021 Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2021 Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve ticketholders and attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads in the Sydney CBD including Circular Quay, The Rocks, Barangaroo, Millers Point and Pyrmont are closed until 4am on New Year's Day.

Key road closure timings:

  • *CLOSED* 5am: roads in the Royal Botanic Garden & Domain including Art Gallery Rd
  • *CLOSED* 12pm: Hickson Rd from Millers Point to Barangaroo.
  • *CLOSED* 2pm: George St/Hickson Rd through The Rocks, Macquarie St north of Bridge St at Circular Quay, Wheat Rd Darling Harbour and Upper Fort St at Observatory Hill.
  • *CLOSED* 5pm: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including sections of Young, Pitt, Loftus and Macquarie Streets, and roads around Hyde Park/the Domain including Hospital Rd, College St, Prince Albert Rd
  • *CLOSED* 7pm: Bridge St/Grosvenor St in the Sydney CBD, and roads in The Rocks, Millers Point and sections of Pirrama Rd in Pyrmont
  • *CLOSED* 10pm: roads around Wynyard including sections of York, Clarence and Margaret Streets
  • *CLOSED* 11pm to 1.30am: roads in Millers Point closed.
  • 4am: most roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont reopened.
  • 6am: Macquarie St north of Bridge St reopens.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect on various roads in the City's North from 12pm on NYE until 4am on NYD. South of Circular Quay between Bridge St and Goulburn St will be in effect from 3pm on NYE until 4am on NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

properties.headline: Sydney New Year's Eve - MCMAHONS POINT Blues Point Road and surrounding roads
properties.publicTransport: Buses are diverting and terminating in North Sydney while roads in McMahons Point are closed, visit transportnsw.info for more details.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE 2021 North Sydney - Road Closure & Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2128_NEW YEARS EVE ROAD CLOSURES NORTH SYDNEY_V007 14DEC21.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE 2021 North Sydney - Road Closure & Clearway Map

properties.adviceB: Use an alternative route; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads in McMahons Point, North Sydney CBD, Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay are closed until 3am on 1 January.

Key road closure timings:

  • *CLOSED* 6pm 30 Dec: Henry Lawson Dr at Blues Point closed
  • *CLOSED* 7pm 30 Dec: Lavender Crescent at Lavender Bay closed
  • *CLOSED* 8pm 30 Dec: Olympic Drive and sections of Broughton St in Milsons Point/Kirribilli closed
  • *CLOSED* 8am 31 Dec: sections of Blues Point Rd, Middle St, East Crescent St and surrounding local roads in McMahons Point closed.
  • *CLOSED* 3pm 31 Dec: Blue St North Sydney closed
  • *CLOSED* 5pm 31 Dec: Alfred St South, Lavender St, Union St, Woolcott St, Miller St, Pacific Hwy southbound and surrounding local roads in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and North Sydney closed
  • *CLOSED* 8pm 31 Dec: Pacific Hwy off-ramp to North Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge closed - use the Falcon St exit. Sections of Walker St also closed. 

Special event clearways are in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 6am NYE and 3am NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

Sydney Tennis Classic at Ken Rosewall Arena from Monday 10 - Saturday 15 January. Day sessions daily from 11am, Night sessions daily from 7pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the event.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to celebrate New Year's Eve (NYE) at the Queens Wharf precinct from 5pm.

Road closures will be in place to support the event at the following locations: 

  • Wharf Rd between Watt St and Argyle St, and Merewether St from Wharf Rd to Worskshop Way from 5am NYE to 1am New Year's Day (NYD). Traffic will be diverted via Merewether St and Watt St.
  • Wharf Rd eastbound lanes from Merewether St roundabout to Argyle St from 5am NYE to 1am NYD.
  • Scott St/Hunter St eastbound lanes from Darby St to Watt St from 4pm to 9:30pm on NYE. Traffic will be diverted via Darby St.
  • Boat Harbour and Queens Wharf East/West car parks will be closed from 5am 30 December until 4pm 2 January.

Traffic may be heavier than normal along the Pacific Hwy, Hannell St and King St on approach to Newcastle East.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.adviceB: Use an alternative route; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads in North Sydney CBD, Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay are closed until 3am. 

Key road closure timings:

  • *CLOSED* 6pm 30 Dec: Henry Lawson Dr at Blues Point closed
  • *CLOSED* 7pm 30 Dec: Lavender Crescent at Lavender Bay closed
  • *CLOSED* 8pm 30 Dec: Olympic Drive and sections of Broughton St in Milsons Point/Kirribilli closed
  • *CLOSED* 8am 31 Dec: sections of Blues Point Rd, Middle St, East Crescent St and surrounding local roads in McMahons Point closed.
  • *CLOSED* 3pm 31 Dec: Blue St North Sydney closure
  • *CLOSED* 5pm 31 Dec: Alfred St South, Lavender St, Union St, Woolcott St, Miller St, Pacific Hwy southbound and surrounding local roads in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and North Sydney closed
  • *CLOSED* 8pm 31 Dec: Pacific Hwy off-ramp to North Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge closed - use the Falcon St exit. Sections of Walker St also closed.

Special event clearways are in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 6am NYE and 3am NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve ticketholders and attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads in the city including Circular Quay, The Rocks and Pyrmont are closed until 4am on New Year's Day.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect on sections of Pirrama Rd at Pirrama Park from 3pm on NYE until 4am on NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as crowds celebrate New Year’s Eve in Cremorne Point.

Sections of Murdoch St from Bannerman St, Iredale Ave from Boyle St and Milson Rd at Cremorne Point wharf are closed from 5pm on NYE until 3am on NYD. 

Special event clearways are in effect on both sides of Milson Rd at Wharf Rd from 6am until 3am. Clearways are also in effect on nearby major roads including Falcon St and Military Rd from Neutral Bay to Mosman between 3pm and 3am.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
